text:
<optional title, max 6 words>

Raskolnikov confronts a troubling past.  
A moment of tension lingers.  
Raskolnikov: “You’ve heard about Marfa Petrovna?”  

Speaker: “Yes, but I’m not worried.”  

Raskolnikov: “I wonder why you care!”  

---
A flash of guilt crosses his face.  
Raskolnikov: “I struck her twice, no marks.”  

Speaker: “You’re not a cynic, right?”  

Raskolnikov: “She might have liked my ‘warmth’.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on the moral implications of his actions and the nature of human relationships, questioning whether he contributed to a calamity.
